Dear Derek,

> I had nothing to do with developing Soccerbots (if
> that's what you're saying).  I'm just making some
> minor adaptations to it to use with NEAT.  It was
> developed by some folks at Carnegie Mellon University
> and Georgia Tech.

Ok sorry, I thought you were involved in the development, but no problem.

I've followed the XML thread (and I've seen the file proposed-neat.xml), it
seems to me that
two general features are important for the standard:

-Neutral standard for indirect and direct encoding.
-Support dynamic addition of domains tags (as proposed by Colin).

The first seems necessary and straight forward since people like you Derek
are working with indirect encoding; I'm not sure if supporting both type of
encodings may generate some kind of conflicts in the standard (seems not to
be a problem).
The second is a little more delicate because I think domain specific tags
may get out of control and make the standard useless.

Right now I do not have more specific comments until I start using the
proposed xml template (in about 15 days).

So far I think it looks good.

Regards.

German
